interval_container.name: Aeolian 7
interval_container.description:
order: 1st degree of harmonic minor (H.M.) = H.M. I key: minor
comments: - developed out of natural minor (N.M.) but in contrast to natural minor (N.M.) harmonic minor (H.M.) has an ending because of the seventh (7) at the end - b6 to 7 = #2 --> "melodic hole" = orientalic sound - development: N.M. (...b6-b7) -> H.M.(...b6-7) -> M.M. (...6-7)

interval_container.name: Dorian #4
interval_container.description:
order: 4th degree of harmonic minor (H.M.) = H.M. IV
comment: - dorian with #4 instead of 4

interval_container.name: Ionian #5
interval_container.description:
order: 3rd degree of harmonic minor (H.M.) = H.M. III
comment: - ionian with #5 instead of 5

interval_container.name: Locrian 6
interval_container.description:
order: 2nd degree of harmonic minor (H.M.) = H.M. II
comments: - locrian with 6 instead of b6 - sometimes used as locrian #6

interval_container.name: Locrian b4 bb7
interval_container.description:
order: 7th degree of harmonic minor (H.M.) = H.M. VII
comment: - locrian with b4 instead of 4 and bb7 instead of b7

interval_container.name: Lydian #2
interval_container.description:
order: 6th degree of harmonic minor (H.M.) = H.M. VI
comment: - lydian with #2 instead of 2

interval_container.name: Phrygian 3
interval_container.description:
order: 5th degree of harmonic minor (H.M.) = H.M. V
comment: - phrygian with 3 instead of b3
